    public abstract class WidgetInComposite
extends pa.iscde.guibuilder.model.compositeContents.ComponentInCompositeImpl
    Service containing the operations to be implemented by an extension to the widget extension point Two examples of use of this class can be found here: https://goo.gl/RNSFna

    • Constructor Detail

      • WidgetInComposite

        public WidgetInComposite(pa.iscde.guibuilder.model.ObjectInComposite.ContextMenuItem[] contextMenuItems)
        Constructor for the widget. It receives an array containing all the options that this widget accepts on a context menu. It is demanding for this class childs to call super constructor with the indication of which context menu elements need/ have to be available
        Parameters:
        contextMenuItems - is an array containing an indication of all context menu items to display in this widget

      • createWidget

        public abstract void createWidget(org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Canvas canvas,
                                  org.eclipse.swt.graphics.Point location,
                                  org.eclipse.swt.graphics.Point size)
        Upon the call of this method, it should create the widget in the canvas and in the indicated position. Don't forget to keep a copy of the variables in the model (i.e. not only in the GUI component), being therefore necessary to update super class values such as control, location, size, backgroundColor, foreground color and enabled.
        Parameters:
        canvas - where widget will be created
        location - of the widget in canvas
        size - of the widget

      • generateWidgetCode

        public abstract java.util.List<java.lang.String> generateWidgetCode(pa.iscde.guibuilder.codeGenerator.CodeGenerator.CodeTarget target,
                                                                    java.lang.String containerName,
                                                                    int count)
        When GUIBuilder code generator is invoked, this method is therefore called. It should generate the code lines for this widget, according to the indicated code target. It is also important to take in note that some code target may need for the widget to refer to a parent component, which is also passed in this method. Finally, in the generated code for this widget, the variables names should be composed of a static prefix plus the count. In the first line of generated code is then returned the used variable name.
        Parameters:
        target - for where to generate the code
        containerName - is the parent container to which the widget may refer, if needed
        count - value to be added to the used variables names
        Returns:
        list with the widget variable name in first place followed by the code lines
